parameters: \n<Velona>I should explore a bit more before going into this pit...
\n<Velona>(Kishu is not ready to delve down here yet.)
Doubt there is anything useful in them.
The mortality enhancement procedure has finally suceeded.
After dozens of failed attempts we have finally done it.
A human turned practically immortal using the power of Ergynite.
We have immediately started testing her
Additional notes will follow as testing commences.
I just couldn't withhold my excitement.
\n<Velona>If mortals are able to replicate this technology,
\n<Velona>I wonder if that girl is still around.
\n<Kishu>Oh. It's a note with my name on it.
\n<Velona>Do you want to read the rest of it?
\n<Kishu>Sure. I may as well read this while I'm here.
The mortality enhancement procedure has finally suceeded.
After dozens of failed attempts we have finally done it.
A human turned practically immortal using the power of Tricerite.
As I write this, we have immediately started testing her
I will continue to report our progress as testing commences.
This is truly a wonderous day.
\n<Kishu>It's pretty creepy reading someone else write about me...
\n<Velona>We should probably just leave the note here
No use carrying it with us.
\n<Velona>A bunch of books covering PEM topics.
We are the ones who reject the afterlife.
The ones who will defy God and live forever.
We will be the saviors of humanity
Creators of a world where death never has to come
Though we may spill the life essence of many before us,
Their sacrifices will live on in our evolution of humankind.
\n<Velona>Damn humans. Willing to kill each other to taste
Just how stupid can they be.
Surgeon's Guide for Operating on New Test Subjects
1. Introduce yourself and bring them to the exam room
3. Add all relevant information to a file and bring it to the front desk
4. Ensure a room is prepared for the subject.
- Convince the subject that it is just a routine shot to keep them healthy.
6. Transfer the subject to the room.
7. Securely restrain the subject to the operating table.
8. Await further instructions from your supervising surgeon.
\n<Velona>A bunch of books covering PEM topics.
\n<Velona>I flipped through these the last time.
We are the ones who reject the afterlife.
The ones who will defy God and live forever.
We will be the saviors of humanity
Creators of a world where death never has to come
Though we may spill the life essence of many before us,
Their sacrifices will live on in our evolution of humankind.
\n<Kishu>It is pretty worrying that people are willing to go
this far to reach their goals.
\n<Kishu>I don't want anyone else to suffer like I did.
Surgeon's Guide for Operating on New Test Subjects
1. Introduce yourself and bring them to the exam room
3. Add all relevant information to a file and bring it to the front desk
4. Ensure a room is prepared for the subject.
- Convince the subject that it is just a routine shot to keep them healthy.
6. Transfer the subject to the room.
7. Securely restrain the subject to the operating table.
8. Await further instructions from your supervising surgeon.
\n<Velona>This was pretty much exactly what happened in
\n<Velona>How foolish of me to blindly follow their orders.

There's nothing in here that could even convert omnee
I think I'm done investigating here.
Better check what's down those stairs now.
\n<Velona>Huh? Is that a can of Doc P...?
\n<Velona>Whoaaa. This is one of my favorite sodas.
Obtained a can of \C[18]Doc P Millenium Edition\C!
\n<Kishu>Um, do we really have to go into the men's room?
\n<Velona>Pretty sure there's a monster hiding spot in here.
\n<Velona>I don't have to use the restroom let alone in this
\n<Velona>Wouldn't hurt to look around here though.
\n<Velona>I knew they were still in here!
Once you straightened out your aim, you became quite the force

straying too far is the right thing to do.

It isn't like slimes and terrorbats are endangered either.

Especially if you're not an adventurer or a mercenary.
You didn't have combat on the curriculum, that's for sure.

a developing field with a growing job market.
\n<Kishu>I was never really talented with weapons or magic so
I went with something more,\. practical I guess.
\n<Kishu>Wait,\| so when did you go to school?

going to take for us to get to Kirahaven.

You went out like a light.

\n<Kishu>I relived the pain I felt. When I was still
\n<Kishu>How it felt to be torn apart.

I can still have a purpose.
\n<Kishu>You're a really kind person you know that?
Any reasonable person would have helped if they could!

Dead weight.\. A mindless drone.\. Useless.

\n<Velona>Well, good to know you're eager to learn.
\n<Velona>You better not freeze up this time though.
\n<Velona>I'm pretty sure the monsters are filing out from the
restroom. So let's check it out.
\n<Velona>I was going to take a look around, but I ended
up dragging you back to my place instead.
There's no telling what else might be down there.
